notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.

taskDescription:
Demonstrate  the density property of rational numbers by finding a rational number between <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>27</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>13</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{27}}{{13}}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>21</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>10</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{21}}{{10}}</annotation></semantics></math>.
detailedSolution:
The process used above yields <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>543</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>260</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{543}}{{260}}</annotation></semantics></math>.
